intro: Aetanthus holtonii, commonly known as the Holton's sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid environments. It has a low-growing habit and produces blue or purple flowers that bloom in the summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
